flawed_nl_solution:
The salon made $200.00 and they charge $20.00 per client so there are 200/20 = <<200/20=10>>10 clients in the salon
There are 210 fingers in the salon and everyone has 10 fingers so there are 210/10 = <<210/10=12>>12 people in the salon
If there are 12 people in the salon and 10 are clients then there are 12-10 = <<12-10=2>>2 people in the salon that are not clients

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 21.0, not 12.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
